wikipedia_page.main: Archibald MacKechnie Baird (8 May 1919 – 3 November 2009) was a Scottish footballer, who played for Aberdeen and St Johnstone. He was also capped once by the Scotland national football team.

response: *  2009   – Archie Baird, Scottish footballer, journalist, and educator (b. 1919)
* Archie Baird, footballer (Aberdeen) and World War II POW

Sally Magnusson was born in 1955 and is the daughter of the Icelandic-born broadcaster and writer Magnus Magnusson. Her mother, Mamie Baird, also worked as a journalist. Footballer Archie Baird was her maternal uncle.
* 3 November – Archie Baird, 90, Aberdeen, St Johnstone and Scotland forward.
Former players of the club include Archie Baird and Willie Waddell, who both went on to be capped at full international level for Scotland.

Baird's middle name, Ian, was on account of the fact that her father, John (a janitor at Bankhead Primary School) had been expecting a boy. Her brother, Archie Baird, was a noted footballer for Aberdeen and Scotland in addition to being an escapee from a German prisoner-of-war camp.
